Check that the server is reachable and that service calls are being properly authenticated.
Obtain a list of existing reports.

post.description:
Request a report.

 When the report has a `COMPLETE` status (as returned by [Retrieve Report](#!/Report/retrieveReport)), you can obtain the report data using [Get Report Data](#!/Report/getReportData).

parameters.description: an optional lower bound on request timestamp
parameters.name: startDate

parameters.description: an optional upper bound on request timestamp
parameters.name: endDate

parameters.description: a comma-delimited list of request/respsonse metadata keys to include in report
parameters.name: metaKeys

parameters.description: a comma-delimited list of error codes to filter out of the report
parameters.name: errorsToFilter

parameters.description: a comma-delimited list of verification statuses to include
parameters.name: statuses

parameters.description: include specific named person data fields in report (as a comma-delimited list of field constants from [List Fields](#!/Field/listFields), or `*` to return all available data). Supplied fields are narrowed to match the data access policies for the calling user.
parameters.name: fields

parameters.description: a number of milliseconds into the past (from the time the report is requested) the report should cover. If `startDate` is supplied, this value is ignored.
parameters.name: delta

parameters.description: `false` to disable email notification upon completion of report
parameters.name: notifyEmail

parameters.description: to include metaKeys specified in the account configuration
parameters.name: reportingConfigurationIncluded

parameters.description: a ID of a template by which to filter requests. If none are specified, will not filter by template. If multiple template IDs are specified, will use OR combination to filter requests.  If template IDs are supplied, the automatic assumption will be that certifications should not be included in the results set, and will override the value of "includeCertifications"
parameters.name: templateId

parameters.description: filter results to just verification requests for which a fee is incurred
parameters.name: invoiceMode

parameters.description: include certifications in the verifications report
parameters.name: includeCertifications

post.description: Get a report of asset review metrics

parameters.description: A set of account ids separated by ",". Example "account1,account2,account3". A null value will return a report for the requesters own accountId

parameters.description: The date/time for the beginning of the report period
parameters.name: startDate

parameters.description: The date/time for the end of the report period
parameters.name: endDate

200.description: A map of asset review metrics

parameters.description: the ID of the report to fetch
parameters.name: reportId

get.description: Obtain a list of reward pools.

post.description:
Create a reward pool.
 A reward pool is a group of unique resources that are intended to be distributed to verified end-users. The pool is used
 by the reward service to issue a unique reward to each verified user.  Examples of pooled rewards include single-use promotional
 codes or activation keys.

parameters.description: a reference name or description for this reward pool
parameters.name: name

parameters.description: the number of entries at which the system will notify that a pool is running low on entries
parameters.name: warnThreshold

delete.description: Delete a reward pool by its id.

parameters.description: the identifier of the reward pool to be removed
parameters.name: rewardPoolId

parameters.name: rewardPoolId

parameters.name: name

parameters.name: warnThreshold

post.description: Create a verification request template.

parameters.description: a name for this template for reference purposes
parameters.name: name

parameters.description: A comma-delimited list of affiliation type names (see [List Affiliation Types](#!/AffiliationType/listAffiliationTypes)). Defines the affiliations the requestor deems acceptable for a given verification. (For example, when attempting to verify that an individual is either a full-time or part-time student: `_affiliationTypes=STUDENT_FULL_TIME,STUDENT_PART_TIME`
parameters.name: _affiliationTypes

parameters.description: A comma-delimited list of verification type names (see [List Verification Types](#!/VerificationType/listVerificationTypes)). Defines the requestor's list of acceptable techniques that may be used to verify an individual.
parameters.name: _verificationTypes

parameters.description: A comma-delimited list of asset type names (see [List Asset Types](#!/AssetType/listAssetTypes)). Defines the requestor's list of acceptable documents for use with `ASSET_REVIEW` verification types.  If `ASSET_REVIEW` is not an allowable verification type, this configuration is ignored.
parameters.name: _assetTypes

parameters.description: A comma-delimited list of Reward IDs (see [List Rewards](#!/Reward/listRewards)). Defines any rewards to be issued when an individual is verified.
parameters.name: _rewardIds

parameters.description: an optional beginning date for this template
parameters.name: begins

parameters.description: an optional expiration date for this template
parameters.name: expires

parameters.description: a boolean option for the starting template state
parameters.name: active

parameters.name: organizationType

parameters.description: `false` to disable matching of organizationName. If `organizationId` is supplied or `organizationName` is not supplied, this parameter is ignored.
parameters.name: matchName

parameters.description: A comma-delimited list of affiliation type names (see [List Affiliation Types](#!/AffiliationType/listAffiliationTypes)). Defines the affiliations the requestor deems acceptable for a given verification. (For example, when attempting to verify that an individual is either a full-time or part-time student: `_affiliationTypes=STUDENT_FULL_TIME,STUDENT_PART_TIME`
parameters.name: _affiliationTypes

parameters.description: A comma-delimited list of verification type names (see [List Verification Types](#!/VerificationType/listVerificationTypes)). Defines the requestor's list of acceptable techniques that may be used to verify an individual.
parameters.name: _verificationTypes

parameters.description: A comma-delimited list of asset type names (see [List Asset Types](#!/AssetType/listAssetTypes)). Defines the requestor's list of acceptable documents for use with `ASSET_REVIEW` verification types.  If `ASSET_REVIEW` is not an allowable verification type, this configuration is ignored.
parameters.name: _assetTypes

parameters.description: A comma-delimited list of Reward IDs (see [List Rewards](#!/Reward/listRewards)). Defines any rewards to be issued when an individual is verified.
parameters.name: _rewardIds

parameters.description: metadata value for the supplied key (ex: `:orderId=179365`)
parameters.name: _metadata key (any string prefixed with `:`)_

post.description:
**Perform a verification.** This is the primary method of importance for most integrations.
 Fields to supply vary based on the affiliations the caller is interested in verifying and the type of verification being performed.  For a list of which fields are relevant for a particular type of request, see the [verification field requirements documentation](http://developer.sheerid.com/docs/fields.html).

parameters.description: An email address, preferably the one issued by the organization being verified
parameters.name: EMAIL

parameters.description: Given name of the verification subject
parameters.name: FIRST_NAME

parameters.description: Surname/family name of the verification subject
parameters.name: LAST_NAME

parameters.description: Complete birth date of the verification subject
parameters.name: BIRTH_DATE

parameters.description: The date on which the affiliation being verified began. For VETERAN, this is the date of discharge/end of active duty status.
parameters.name: STATUS_START_DATE

parameters.description: an optional organization id, see [List Organizations](#!/Organization/listOrganizations)
parameters.name: organizationId

parameters.description: an organization name supplied when the ID is not known. If `organizationId` is supplied, this parameter is ignored.
parameters.name: organizationName

parameters.description: an organization type (see [List Organization Types](#!/OrganizationType/listOrganizationTypes)) to help when matching the organization name.  If `organizationId` is supplied or `organizationName` is not supplied, this parameter is ignored.
parameters.name: organizationType

parameters.description: `false` to disable matching of organizationName. If `organizationId` is supplied or `organizationName` is not supplied, this parameter is ignored.
parameters.name: matchName

parameters.description: A comma-delimited list of affiliation type names (see [List Affiliation Types](#!/AffiliationType/listAffiliationTypes)). Defines the affiliations the requestor deems acceptable for a given verification. (For example, when attempting to verify that an individual is either a full-time or part-time student: `_affiliationTypes=STUDENT_FULL_TIME,STUDENT_PART_TIME`
parameters.name: _affiliationTypes

parameters.description: A comma-delimited list of verification type names (see [List Verification Types](#!/VerificationType/listVerificationTypes)). Defines the requestor's list of acceptable techniques that may be used to verify an individual.
parameters.name: _verificationTypes

parameters.description: A comma-delimited list of asset type names (see [List Asset Types](#!/AssetType/listAssetTypes)). Defines the requestor's list of acceptable documents for use with `ASSET_REVIEW` verification types.  If `ASSET_REVIEW` is not an allowable verification type, this configuration is ignored.
parameters.name: _assetTypes

parameters.description: A comma-delimited list of Reward IDs (see [List Rewards](#!/Reward/listRewards)). Defines any rewards to be issued when an individual is verified.
parameters.name: _rewardIds

parameters.description: metadata value for the supplied key (ex: `:orderId=179365`)
parameters.name: _metadata key (any string prefixed with `:`)_

parameters.description: the identifier of an existing template (see [Create Template](#!/Template/createTemplate)) from which to source verification request configuration. If this value is supplied, any other request configuration directives (parameters prefixed with `_`) are ignored.
parameters.name: templateId

parameters.description: a custom identifier for tracking a unique end-user as recognized by a client system
parameters.name: endUserId

parameters.description: the end-user's IP address, may be supplied in situations where the API is invoked by an intermediate server
parameters.name: endUserIp

get.description:
[Beta] Get an authorizedVerificationRequest containing a verification request schema.
 This method is in beta and is subject to change.

[Beta] Get an existing authorizedVerificationRequest containing a verification request schema.
 This method is in beta and is subject to change.

put.description:
[Beta] Verify a authorizedVerificationRequest.
 This method is in beta and is subject to change.

get.description: Check the status of a historical verification.

parameters.description: the identifier returned with the original request
parameters.name: requestId

post.description:
Update and re-submit an existing verification request.
 The previous response to this request must have a result of `null`, otherwise update is disallowed. Only identity data can be changed (parameter names as described by [List Fields](#!/Field/listFields)). Organization id/name or other configuration supplied with the original request is not modifiable.

parameters.description: the identifier returned with the original request
parameters.name: requestId

parameters.description: An email address, preferably the one issued by the organization being verified
parameters.name: EMAIL

parameters.description: Given name of the verification subject
parameters.name: FIRST_NAME

parameters.description: Surname/family name of the verification subject
parameters.name: LAST_NAME

parameters.description: Complete birth date of the verification subject
parameters.name: BIRTH_DATE

parameters.description: The date on which the affiliation being verified began. For VETERAN, this is the date of discharge/end of active duty status.
parameters.name: STATUS_START_DATE

get.description: Obtain a list of the digital assets that accompany a particular verification request.

parameters.description: the identifier of a verification request
parameters.name: requestId

post.description: Update meta-data pertaining to a verification request.

parameters.description: the identifier returned with the original request
parameters.name: requestId

parameters.description: string value used to store meta-data with a request
parameters.name: _a string key_

get.description:
Return available person data entered during a request if it has not already been purged in accordance with customer
 data retention policies. This request requires the PERSON_DATA role for the user making the request.

parameters.description: the identifier of a verification request
parameters.name: requestId

post.description:
Submit a prepared verification request.
 Request must be in the `NEW` status as created by [Prepare Verification Request](#!/Verification/prepareVerificationRequest).

parameters.description: the identifier returned with the original request
parameters.name: requestId

get.description: Obtain a list of verification types.
